categories.name: Verbs
categories.description: Common English verbs and their usage

flashcards.question: To seize an opportunity
flashcards.notes: Can also mean to understand something

flashcards.question: Break the ice
flashcards.notes: Used in social situations to make people feel comfortable

flashcards.question: Extremely beautiful or impressive
flashcards.notes: Often used to describe people, views, or achievements

flashcards.question: To make something less severe
flashcards.notes: Commonly used in formal or technical contexts

flashcards.question: A blessing in disguise
flashcards.answer: Something good that seemed bad at first
flashcards.notes: Example: Losing my job was a blessing in disguise

flashcards.question: Full of energy and enthusiasm
flashcards.notes: Can describe people, colors, or atmospheres

flashcards.question: To speak or write at length about
flashcards.notes: Often used with 'on': Please elaborate on your answer

flashcards.question: Hit the nail on the head
flashcards.notes: Used when someone says something precisely accurate

flashcards.question: Existing in thought but not reality
To make something seem less important
flashcards.notes: Often used in discussions or arguments

flashcards.question: The best of both worlds
flashcards.notes: Having two different benefits at the same time

flashcards.question: To make a problem worse
flashcards.notes: Often used in medical or formal contexts

flashcards.question: Once in a blue moon
flashcards.notes: Refers to something that almost never happens

flashcards.question: Temporary and not lasting
flashcards.notes: Often used to describe beauty, moments, or phenomena
